title: Contributing to subfoldr2
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to subfoldr2
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("", fork = TRUE). Install development dependences devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. Begin commit merge messages - indicate user facing changes included NEWS.md. use fledge automatically generate NEWS.md file.

title: Contributing to subfoldr2
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Save and Load R Objects
text: subfoldr2 R package facilitate saving loading R objects data frames (tables) strings (code blocks) numbers ggplot objects (windows png files) opening closing graphics windows pdfs database (SQLite) connections

title: Save and Load R Objects
text: default files saved output unless overridden using sbf_set_main() can take relative absolute path.
code: library(subfoldr2) sbf_set_main(tempdir(), "output")

title: Save and Load R Objects
text: R object can written using sbf_save_object() read using sbf_load_object(). R objects saved .rds files folder objects (main folder).
code: x <- 1 sbf_save_object(x) sbf_load_object("x") #> [1] 1 list.files(sbf_get_main(), recursive = TRUE) #>  [1] "data/data2.rds"  "data/df.rds"     "numbers/x.csv"   "numbers/x.rds"   "numbers/x3.csv"  "numbers/x3.rds"  "objects/x.rds"   #>  [8] "strings/chr.rda" "strings/chr.rds" "strings/chr.txt"

title: Save and Load R Objects
text: user can save objects particular sub folder within objects using sbf_set_sub() sub = sbf_get_sub() argument sbf_save_object().
code: sbf_set_sub("times2") x <- x * 2 sbf_save_object(x) sbf_save_object(x * 3, x_name = "x3", sub = "times2/times3") sbf_save_object(data.frame(), x_name = "df", sub = "times2/times3") list.files(sbf_get_main(), recursive = TRUE) #>  [1] "data/data2.rds"               "data/df.rds"                  "numbers/x.csv"                "numbers/x.rds"                #>  [5] "numbers/x3.csv"               "numbers/x3.rds"               "objects/times2/times3/df.rds" "objects/times2/times3/x3.rds" #>  [9] "objects/times2/x.rds"         "objects/x.rds"                "strings/chr.rda"              "strings/chr.rds"              #> [13] "strings/chr.txt"

title: Save and Load R Objects
text: user can load objects current sub folder calling environment using sbf_load_objects() recursively load objects list column data frame using sbf_load_objects_recursive().
code: print(sbf_set_sub("times2", "times3")) #> [1] "times2/times3" sbf_load_objects() ls() #> [1] "chr"   "data2" "df"    "vec"   "x"     "x3" sbf_load_objects_recursive(sub = "times2") #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>   objects      name  sub      file                                                                                            #>   <list>       <chr> <chr>    <chr>                                                                                           #> 1 <df [0 × 0]> df    "times3" /var/folders/yg/xzvpt0r53gsgj094f3sxb1n00000gn/T/RtmpwTf1sn/output/objects/times2/times3/df.rds #> 2 <dbl [1]>    x3    "times3" /var/folders/yg/xzvpt0r53gsgj094f3sxb1n00000gn/T/RtmpwTf1sn/output/objects/times2/times3/x3.rds #> 3 <dbl [1]>    x     ""       /var/folders/yg/xzvpt0r53gsgj094f3sxb1n00000gn/T/RtmpwTf1sn/output/objects/times2/x.rds

title: Save and Load R Objects
text: recursively delete sub folder call sbf_set_sub() rm = TRUE.
code: sbf_set_sub("times2", rm = TRUE, ask = FALSE) list.files(sbf_get_main(), recursive = TRUE) #>  [1] "data/data2.rds"  "data/df.rds"     "numbers/x.csv"   "numbers/x.rds"   "numbers/x3.csv"  "numbers/x3.rds"  "objects/x.rds"   #>  [8] "strings/chr.rda" "strings/chr.rds" "strings/chr.txt"

title: Save and Load R Objects
text: objects calling environment can saved current subdirectory using sbf_save_objects().
code: ls() #> [1] "chr"   "data2" "df"    "vec"   "x"     "x3" sbf_save_objects() list.files(sbf_get_main(), recursive = TRUE) #>  [1] "data/data2.rds"           "data/df.rds"              "numbers/x.csv"            "numbers/x.rds"            #>  [5] "numbers/x3.csv"           "numbers/x3.rds"           "objects/times2/chr.rds"   "objects/times2/data2.rds" #>  [9] "objects/times2/df.rds"    "objects/times2/vec.rds"   "objects/times2/x.rds"     "objects/times2/x3.rds"    #> [13] "objects/x.rds"            "strings/chr.rda"          "strings/chr.rds"          "strings/chr.txt" rm(x, x3, df) sbf_load_objects() print(x3) #> [1] 6 print(df) #> data frame with 0 columns and 0 rows

title: Save and Load R Objects
text: functions saving loading R objects members families functions specific types object. particular family members numbers (numeric scalars) strings (character scalars) data (objects inheriting data.frame) types object saved rds files. However facilitate viewing, number also saved csv file string also saved txt file.
code: sbf_reset_sub(rm = TRUE, ask = FALSE) #> ✔ Directory '/var/folders/yg/xzvpt0r53gsgj094f3sxb1n00000gn/T/RtmpwTf1sn/output' deleted data2 <- data.frame(x = 5:6, y = 7:8) chr <- "some text" vec <- c(1, 3) # not saved as vector sbf_save_datas() sbf_save_strings() sbf_save_numbers() list.files(sbf_get_main(), recursive = TRUE) #> [1] "data/data2.rds"  "data/df.rds"     "numbers/x.csv"   "numbers/x.rds"   "numbers/x3.csv"  "numbers/x3.rds"  "strings/chr.rda" #> [8] "strings/chr.rds" "strings/chr.txt"

title: Save and Load R Objects
text: connection SQLite database (current subfolder dbs folder) can opened using conn <- sbf_open_db() individual connection can closed using sbf_close_db(conn). Alternatively, sbf_save_datas_to_db() automatically open closes connection uses readwritesqlite::rws_read_sqlite.environment write data frames calling environment. opposite function, sbf_load_datas_from_db(), uses rws_read_sqlite.SQLiteConnection save tables calling environment.

title: Download files from AWS S3 — sbf_save_aws_files
text: sbf_save_aws_files() moved subfoldr2ext::sbfx_save_aws_files(). Download files AWS S3 bucket analysis.

title: Download files from AWS S3 — sbf_save_aws_files
code: sbf_save_aws_files(   bucket_name,   sub = sbf_get_sub(),   main = sbf_get_main(),   data_type = NULL,   year = NULL,   month = NULL,   day = NULL,   file_name = NULL,   file_extension = NULL,   max_request_size = 1000,   ask = getOption("sbf.ask", TRUE),   silent = TRUE,   aws_access_key_id = Sys.getenv("AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID"),   aws_secret_access_key = Sys.getenv("AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY"),   region = Sys.getenv("AWS_REGION", "ca-central-1") )

title: Download files from AWS S3 — sbf_save_aws_files
text: bucket_name string AWS S3 bucket name. sub string specifying path sub folder (default current sub folder). main string specifying path main folder (default current main folder) data_type string (default NULL) data type return. Check folder names within shiny-upload AWS options common examples include punch-data, tracks, logger, image pdf. year whole number (default NULL) indicating year return. Format YYYY. month whole number (default NULL) indicating month return. Format MM. day whole number (default NULL) indicating day return. Format DD. file_name string (default NULL) containing name file return. include extension type. file_extension string (default NULL) file extension return. include period. max_request_size whole number (default 1000) indicating maximum number files returned. ask flag specifying whether ask overwriting files. silent flag (default FALSE) silence messages number files returned. Set TRUE silence messages. aws_access_key_id string AWS user access key ID. default environment variable named AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID. aws_secret_access_key string AWS user secret access key. default environment variable named AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY. region string AWS region. default environment variable named AWS_REGION.

title: Upload flobs — sbf_upload_flobs_to_db
text: db_name string database name. sub logical scalar specifying whether import flobs based filename (sub = FALSE) name subdirectory (sub = TRUE) must contain 1 file. sub = NA replace = TRUE names subdirectories used irrespective whether include files existing flobs deleted corresponding subdirectory empty. sub = TRUE sub = NA recursion just one subfolder deep. main string specifying path main folder (default current main folder) dir string path directory import files . Files need within nested folders like 'table1/column1/.csv'. structure created automatically save_all_flobs() function used. dbflobr_sub logical scalar specifying whether import flobs based filename (sub = FALSE) name subdirectory (sub = TRUE) must contain 1 file. sub = NA replace = TRUE names subdirectories used irrespective whether include files existing flobs deleted corresponding subdirectory empty. sub = TRUE sub = NA recursion just one subfolder deep. exists logical scalar specifying whether column must (TRUE) (FALSE) already exist whether matter (NA). FALSE, new BLOB column created. replace flag indicating whether replace existing flobs (TRUE) (FALSE).

title: subfoldr2 1.0.1
text: Changing sbf_compare_data() default argument ignore_attr FALSE TRUE (#114). Added sbf_save_spatial() (#111).

title: subfoldr2 1.0.0
text: Moved functions requiring psql readwriteaws (associated tests) subfoldr2ext removed dependencies. General package upkeep.

title: subfoldr2 0.2.0
text: Add plot argument sbf_print() skip printing plots.

title: subfoldr2 0.1.0
text: Added echo response messages sbf_archive_main() sbf_rm_main() (computer tells user option chose).

title: subfoldr2 0.0.0.9047
text: Added ask argument sbf_save_aws_files().

title: subfoldr2 0.0.0.9046
text: Added sbf_save_gpkgs(). Added sbf_save_gpkg(). Allow time tables. Added sbf_add_column_to_db(). Added dbflobr_sub arguments saving uploading flobs.

title: subfoldr2 0.0.0.9045
text: Added sbf_rm_flobs() removed rm argument sbf_save_flobs_from_db(). Added sbf_save_flobs_from_db() sbf_upload_flobs_to_db(). Added sbf_get_db_name() sbf_path_db(). Added sbf_save_db_metatable_descriptions() Added sbf_query_db(). Added sbf_write_datas_to_xlsx(). Added sbf_diff_datas().

title: subfoldr2 0.0.0.9044
text: Added sbf_compare_datas(). Added sbf_compare_data(). Allow archive = 1L argument take path.

title: subfoldr2 0.0.0.9043
text: Test fix sbf_all_equal_datas(). Added sbf_all_equal_datas() tested! Added full_path = TRUE argument sbf_list_xx() functions. Added sbf_is_equal_data(). Add sbf_get_archive() Added sbf_unarchive_main() added main argument sbf_rm_main(). Added sbf_rm_main().

title: subfoldr2 0.0.0.9042
text: Added sbf_archive_main().

title: subfoldr2 0.0.0.9041
text: sbf_print() now provides informative error messages! Added sbf_create_db(). Rename sbf_db_execute() sbf_execute_db(). Added sbf_db_execute().

title: subfoldr2 0.0.0.9040
text: Hard deprecate database metadata. Resetting main longer resets sub - use sbf_reset() instead. Add sbf_reset(). Add sbf_get_db_name(), sbf_set_db_name() sbf_reset_db_name(). Added exists = NA sbf_diff_xx() functions removed sbf_diff_plot_data().

title: subfoldr2 0.0.0.9039
text: Added sbf_diff_data(), sbf_diff_table() sbf_diff_plot_data(). Add argument silent sbf_print() silence non-grid error messages. sbf_print retries grid errors sbf_print() longer silent default. Added sbf_print() try printing multiple times. Added exists = TRUE sbf_load_xx().

title: subfoldr2 0.0.0.9038
text: Added exists = TRUE sbf_load_xx().
